Reviews.Title: “Nice location and rooms”
Reviews.Author: Meredith36
Reviews.Content: The rooms were immaculate and building was very nice and location right next to medieval times was perfect. We were upgraded to the club floor which was very nice and front desk service overall was amazing. The service in the club room lounge was disappointing. The server was rude/unhelpful and the overall quality of product in the clubroom was below what I'm accustomed to in nice hotels. The charge for internet and parking was disappointing as well. They have tons of parking available and its outdoor so I don't really see why it couldn't be included. Internet is generally free these days so this is a little dated on the part of the hotel too. I did have free internet at this location through AT&T but none of the other guests in my party did. I guess being with AT&T was a bonus here. I'd stay here again for a night or so but for a lengthy stay I'd chose somewhere that includes free internet and either covered parking or free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Happy with our stay.”
Reviews.Author: Sasahm
Reviews.Content: This was a business trip for my husband and a pleasure trip for me. The hotel is nicely decorated, but the best part is the quality of their customer service. Everyone is very friendly here. We were impressed by the handwritten thank-you note from the front desk that was slipped under our door after our arrival. Yes, the bedrooms are a tight squeeze, as mentioned by another reviewer, but they are comfortable and most importantly, clean. Two small bumps for me: the pool was closed, due to someone breaking a glass in there. Maybe tonight my daughter can get a swim in, before we check out tomorrow. The other thing is the spotty wi-fi signal. I'm constantly having to re-connect. This has also provided a problem for my husband, who has to work online. Wouldn't be as big of a deal if you didn't have to pay $10/night for a crappy connection... But overall, we are happy with our choice of hotels. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Good Solid Hotel Close to Downtown Dallas”
Reviews.Author: SteelCity13
Reviews.Content: This place is a great value for your money and its close to everything! The hotel is very well maintained and well decorated for its age. The rooms are very clean and homey feeling. And the hotel has all the amenties you could need including convience store,pool,business center,and beautiful bar and resturant. Its a solid choice for the money!

Reviews.Title: “Renovated with good proximity to downtown”
Reviews.Author: es_in_tx
Reviews.Content: A school team my son and I were traveling with chose this hotel based on cost, room size, and proximity to downtown where the event was being held. The hotel's interior had been renovated recently and it looked nice. The hotel itself has some age but overall, it has been well maintained. The rooms were good size (we had a suite), although two beds were put in the separate bedroom making it a bit cramped. Overall rooms were well done with the only exception of being short outlets which was surprising given the recent renovations. The staff was friendly. Food was ok. This was a bit of a challenge as there were not many eating establishments within walking distance. Overall, I would stay there again if budget were a concern. For the cost, it is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: chart615
Reviews.Content: The check-in process is always smooth and the front desk staff is friendly and professional. I enjoy coming to this location. I stay often and I like this location for a quick getaway. They are my favorite place to host a stay-cation. The room was immaculate and the temperature was near perfect. The housekeeping staff deserves to be commended for the way they service the rooms. The displays created in the restrooms with the towels is always lovely. The tissue is creased and shows attention to detail. I will return several times this year.

Reviews.Title: “Several Problems - Fast Remedies”
Reviews.Author: kfraga212
Reviews.Content: We had several issues with this hotel, but the staff was friendly and quickly remedied everyone. Check-in was at 3. We arrived at 5 and our rooms were not ready. We had to wait an additional 15 minutes. When we got to our room, the a/c was blowing out warm air. I told the manager and it was fixed very quickly. The bed was awesome. There was also a free shuttle that took us downtown. The hotel is only 2 miles from House of Blues and a number of other bars and restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Colette B
Reviews.Content: This was a great stay. MIKE AT THE FRONT DESK WAS ABSOLUTELY FABULOUS!! My husband & I are recently married & have decided that one weekend of each month we will "getaway". Since I recently lost my job this trip almost didn't happen but when we arrived he saw we were from his hometown of Oklahoma & loved our story so he upgraded us, & gave us a few perks like a room with a great view of the skyline, which was fantastic for the fireworks display that just happened to be downtown that weekend! Great service, great breakfast, great hotel....I will be back! Thanks again Mike!!!

Reviews.Title: “Sheraton Suites know how to please their customers.”
Reviews.Author: toetagg
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay at the Sheraton Suites and I came back because My first stay was so awesome. Seems like the service improved and I Thought it was perfect the first time around. Very professional and they cater to their guests needs. Next time in dallas I will look no further than the Sheraton Suites.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: S J
Reviews.Content: I wish to say that whomever hired LeShawn Stark hired an assest to the company. I was in Dallas at your hotel last month and had many other choices to choose but I chose the Sheraton Suites in the Market Center from word of mouth. Ms. Stark made the visit very comfortable due to her professionalism, hospitality and knowledge of the surrounding areas to visit during my stay. She had a very pleasant smile on her face always. Keep hiring people like her and you will always have a business. Enjoy your day and thanks for reading. Ms. Jones

Reviews.Title: “Just getting by”
Reviews.Author: livesinhotels
Reviews.Content: This is a property that I have returned to for many years only because of its location. The good: The front desk staff has improved in many ways and seems to have learned that being friendly and helpful is a better option than rude and indifferent. Four stars to the staff for the improved attitude. I will also give the housekeeping staff a positive review for the basics of the room cleaning. They also have improved significantly. For the first time in all my stayâ€™s I was provided with a bathrobe in the closet. However the first time they cleaned my room I never saw my robe again. The bad: This property is directly adjacent to a major freeway. The road noise can be challenging. My room had a soil mark the size of a dinner plate in the living room. This is a maintenance issue and I cannot fault the housekeeper. The management needs to shampoo carpets regularly. Toiletries are the most basic and I would recommend using your own. The SPG club room is sad. During my stay, someone twice, set off the smoke detector while cooking toast. You are advised to leave the hotel using the stairs. Many people not knowing it was a false alarm trudged down the stairs. This room is monitored by a very attentive staff member who has been there for several years but he is working with an old setup! Room Toiletâ€™s are very sensitive. I seem to have problems with them every time I stay. Elevators are supposed to be keyed off to the floor with your room key. I found one elevator required the key the other did not. This has been like this for years. One of the elevators also has been on its last legs for several years. The doors take a long time to close and the marble floors are cracked and poorly maintained. The rooms need to be re-done as many guest have mentioned you cannot open th closet doors because the bed is so large for the space in the bedroom.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Customer Service”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl R
Reviews.Content: IWe are SPG members and have been for quite a few years..We have stayed at a number of properties..I chose to stay at the Sheraton Suites in Market Center. We have had to stay at the Suites for a little over a month until my family and I can move into our new loft downtown...The staff members have been extremely courteous and helpful from Daniel who drives the shuttle, to Tamara Harris and Mike Green at the front desk, to the General Manager Michael Stockman. They have all given the Sheraton brand true value! Thanks for making our home away from home excellent! Cheryl and family!

Reviews.Title: “Hospitality!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kelvin F
Reviews.Content: I went to Dallas for 1 day and had to add an extra day. I have to say the price was actually reasonable for the event I went for. The Staff was great as well when I had to changes things around it was no problem. I was able to stay in the same room. The room was nice. coffee was decent in the room. Maid service great!! By the way there was a microwave and refrigerator in the room. I had no problems at all!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed”
Reviews.Author: Ray840
Reviews.Content: Only have two complaints. 1) Hallway smelled like smoke. 2) I booked 2 rooms and was told that they were next to each other when in fact they were 8 rooms down. Other than that, the lobby was very nice and clean, the rooms were big and comfy. The front desk was nice and helpful. Breakfast was pretty good. I will stay here again if given the chance.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience.”
Reviews.Author: couldnotbelieve
Reviews.Content: I went to Dallas for 4 days and had to add an extra day. I have to say the price was actually reasonable for the event I went for. The Staff was great as well when I had to changes things around it was no problem. I was able to stay in the same room. The room was nice. coffee was decent in the room. Maid service great!! By the way there was a microwave and refrigerator in the room. I had no problems at all!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice room for the price”
Reviews.Author: gallivanter152
Reviews.Content: I got a good rate for this spacious suite. I enjoy being able to have space to entertain friends/collegues for a drink in my room and this suite was a perfect set up for that. The front desk staff was friendlly and helpful. The hallway on my floor had a rather funky smell but everything else was nice.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT STAY HERE”
Reviews.Author: Joshua S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is horrific. Due to overbooking, the manager at this hotel unilaterally cancalled my reservation and that of my business partner. To compound his error, the manager made no effort whatsoever to support a rebooking at another property in Dallas. Furthermore, he elected to leave the hotel rather than face the issue and provided no guidance to his front desk staff as to how to handle the situation. I've been travelling for business for nearly 15 years and have never experienced such shoddy customer service. This is despite being a Starwood Preferred member. I suppose the burly security guard that stood watch over the door should have been the first clue that all was not right with this hotel. Do not stay here...there are many better options in Dallas. Awful, awful, awful.

Reviews.Title: “Room not available”
Reviews.Author: Gijsje_11
Reviews.Content: After the reception confirmed guaranteed late arrival by phone in the afternoon and put a note in our reservation we arrived at the hotel around midnight to find it was "overbooked" and our reservation had been cancelled. No room, no overflow hotel, no suggestions and no help from the receptionist. While scrambling on the phone to find a new hotel other preferred customers where allowed to check in. As an Starwood Preferred Guest this is the first time I have been treated so poorly. I left my business card for the manager with the friendly request to call me the next day with an explanation, which unfortunately never happened. In the end we found ourselves a great hotel with great service in the same price range. Even if you like this property and the location, please make sure your room will actually be available upon arrival and don't assume anything.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice Before Staying”
Reviews.Author: afclakr
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week while in Dallas area on business. I had arrived very early in the morning and was looking to just drop my bags off, but the front desk was able to accomodate me with a room. Great! all downhill from there....i returned later to see about a room on the club level, which was available. No toilet paper in room, i had to go to front desk to get one. For 5 days I hadnâ€™t gotten any new amenities...including soap. Again, i had to return to the front desk to get a bar of soap. The bed was very comfortable but the highway noise sometimes can be unberable...the closet doors are too close to the bed its tough to open them while at the foot of the bed. Bright spot? A very decent breakfast was available in the club lounge and the gentleman in the lounge "Abu" was very professional and polite. Comfortable beds; shuttle service within a 3 mile area; Low spots: Older hotel ; dirty carpets in hallway and i'm not really sure they vaccumed my floor because i placed two sunflower seeds on the floor and they were there all week during my stay.

Reviews.Title: “Bad experience”
Reviews.Author: Bradphi
Reviews.Content: Frequent SPG guest and have to say that this property did not stack up to usual standards of Sheraton and other SPG properties. - Carpet was stained, inside of room door had gross grease/oil all dripping down (appears that the door-closing mechanism was leaking). - Upon late-evening return to room, discovered that electronic key was not working. Headed to front-desk suspecting that my key had been demagnetized. Tried again, with no luck. This time, I asked that an employee accompany me to room to try their master key. No luck. Maintenance spent 30 to 45 minutes using a coat-hangar like device to manually pull the inside door handle. When we finally got into the room, we discovered that Housekeeping had not attended-to the room -- in other words, housekeeping lilkely tried their key much earlier in the day, discovered they were unable to enter, and chose to ignore the problem (so that we could come home late in the evening to deal with this). When I called the front-desk to explain that hotel staff must have been aware of the door-lock issue, the staff member was rude. Did receive a call-back from the manager, who offered two free breakfasts, and towels were delivered to room.

Reviews.Title: “Not your typical Starwoods Property but fine for business”
Reviews.Author: BBuddy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Sheraton Market Suites for a week while attending a conference across the street at the Hilton. It was only a 5 minute walk but the difference of walking into the lobby at the Hilton and the lobby at the Sheraton was miles apart. Many of the reviews here seem to really slam the Sheraton, and while it wasnâ€™t a four star hotel it was certainly worth the money spent. I am a Gold member Starwoods member but for the second time checking into a Starwoods property I was not upgraded nor received any of the benefits of the Gold status. The guy at check in said that they were booked and couldnâ€™t even put me on the Starwoods Preferred Floor AND to top it off my room was right next to the elevator (I donâ€™t like to stay in these rooms since you can either here the elevator going up and down or hear the â€œdingâ€� when the doors open. Luckily, It was on the other side of the elevators and I never heard a thing. I was on the 7th floor. Additionally, my room rate included free wifi and a buffet breakfast each day. The rooms at this Sheraton are all suites and consisted of a room with a king size bed and a room with a couch and a desk, along with a bar area (without a sink). It also included a microwave and a refrigerator. The room was clean, however, it was showing some wear. The wall behind the desk was all marked up, probably from people reclining back on the desk chair. The set up in the bedroom room was a bit difficult to maneuver around. The closet is located along the wall with the windows and when you open the door to the closet you canâ€™t get around the bed which made unpacking and repacking a bit difficult. Additionally, there is not much room between the bureau and bed but itâ€™s manageable. The bed was very comfortable and there were lots of pillows. I even used the pillows meant for the pull out couch which I never used. Sheraton or Starwoods is starting a new â€œserviceâ€�. If you decide not to have your room serviced for any day of your stay excluding the final day, you can get 500 Starwoods points. Not sure if it is really worth it. It seems that they only give you new shampoo and conditioner if you throw the old ones away. For 3 days I hadnâ€™t gotten any new amenities until I tossed the empty the containers in the trash. They also didnâ€™t give you an extra roll of toilet paper. I had one the first day and never saw an extra roll for the rest of the stay. The staff at the hotel was very friendly from the front desk clerks to the people running the buffet. I had a problem with the TV in the bedroom and the maintenance guy was up quick only to tell me that it would take a day or so to fix it. When they fixed it they left a bag of microwave popcorn for me. Additionally, one evening I was waiting for a friend to pick me up and the doorman asked me if I needed a water. The breakfast buffet is fine, typical food, scrambled eggs, sausage, bacon, oatmeal, fruit, and yogurt. As I mentioned earlier I was supposed to get a complimentary breakfast each morning so I sat down the first morning, no one was there serving and got a plate and a water. After about 15 minutes someone finally showed up and I told him I had a free breakfast so he asked for my card/coupon which I never received. He went to the front desk and the desk clerk came over with coupons for me for the week and apologized for any inconvenience. I didnâ€™t work out in the gym but I did check it out. It was on the small side and you could do a workout with dumbbells. There is one cable machine and some treadmills. There are also two pools, one inside and one outside with a Jacuzzi inside. This hotel was fine for a work conference, I donâ€™t know if Iâ€™d want to stay here on vacation. I didnâ€™t have a rental car and there is practically nothing within walking distance of the hotel. I did walk around at night and there are no sidewalks and some of the area is pretty sketchy so I would not recommend walking around outside. A cab ride to the DFW airport costs about $48.00 (including tip) from this hotel. The hotel provides free transportation to the Lovefield airport

Reviews.Title: “Ok, but definitely better Dallas places”
Reviews.Author: KansasCityGuy
Reviews.Content: I am an SPG Platinum. I'm not a thrilled SPG Elite, but still try and take advantage of that status when I can (I am focusing in 2011 on a competitor due to many issues I have with SPG, but that's a different posting). I made my reservation about 2 months ago, because I endlessly hope that will help my causing. No dice. I checked in for the first of my 3 nights and was given a room on the 7th floor (?-not even a SPG floor) and club access. The room itself was very average. There were cosmetic issues such as a chipped tub, tiny bedroom (which is typical for Sheraton Suite kings I find), and no CNN-only Headline News (?). I went to bed at 10pm to get a good night sleep for my conference across the street at the Hilton Anatole (very convenient walk). I got 2 hours of sleep. My room was literally right next to the highway. All the comments on highway noise do not do justice. I have a sleep machine on my iPhone that was turned up as much as possible, and it still did not drown out the noise of the freeway. It was one of the worst hotel nights I've ever had. That morning, I visited Tanya at the front desk. She exceeded my expectations by allowing me to move immediately that morning prior to leaving for the conference. Tanya is no doubt the highlight of this hotel. She was awesome. She moved me to another room on the same floor (? what happened to SPG benefits to be on the Club or even SPG floors?). Oh well, I was relieved to no longer face the highway. The new room was a double (I told her I would be happy to take that if that was what was available). The bedroom was actually much larger in the Double, and had more space to walk around. The only other difference is a smaller sink. The only issue I had was a leaky shower head, but I covered that with a washcloth to deal with it. On the Club, it seems to have one of the better food options I've seen-full buffet breakfast of eggs and such in the AM, and pasta dinner the one night I went up to the lounge (I was not in the pasta mood, so that didn't really turn me on). Unfortunately, it does not serve alcohol at all (?). The rest of the service was fine. There are definitely better places to stay in DFW--I've been there. This was okay, but I wish I had stayed at the Hilton.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: delgal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here because he was attending a conference downtown. This location is mainly for business people attending meetings and conferences. The rooms are suites and, altho they could use a little updating, they were upscale, comfortable and clean. Beds were great. Tamara at the front desk is super friendly and accommodating. Daniel the shuttle driver, who starts at 4PM, is very nice and gave me his cell #, so I could arrange transportation directly with him. The free shuttle runs on the half hour and if you schedule ahead of time, they are available to take you to meetings, the airport, or drop you off at a mall. There is a breakfats buffet for $13.95 and lunch and dinner are also served in the hotel restaurant, all of which I didn't sample. There is not much around the area to walk to or see. I would highly recommend a walk across the street (don't drive, as parking is $9) to the Hilton Anatole. It's gorgeous inside with atriums and artwork and has a nice upscale casual restaurant. But even if you don't eat, it's worth a trip to look around.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough”
Reviews.Author: JKTexas
Reviews.Content: I read a bunch of mixed reviews for this hotel. I thought I should add a generally positive review. Nice large rooms. Rooms were as large as any other typical full service "suite" hotel that I have been in (namely Marriott Suites). We had 2 rooms, 1 King, and 1 double -- double was slightly larger in the bedroom area (understandably) while the King had a balcony - very nice! Furnishings are slightly dated but not terribly so. Comfortable bed, nicely landscaped grounds, and what appears to be an ever-present security guard in the parking lot at night. Internet was tolerable at best (don't try to stream anything though). TV had a good variety of channels though HD channels are limited. Only minor nit was club lounge had less than average amenities at night but it was the weekend after all. I would return for a visit and recommend the hotel,

Reviews.Title: “Look Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: avt1998
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel several times over the past 18 months since it is a Starwood property that is close to my company's office. However, I have decided to try out the Aloft downtown which is priced similar and is rated much higher. Laundry list of problems ... coffee station always seems to be missing something, and I usually have to call repeatedly and wait hours before someone finally brings me what I need. Last time, I was told they ran out of coffee!!! Frequently, the front desk doesn't answer the phone. The internet connection doesn't work in some rooms. TV channels are missing (HBO is just a blank screen). To top it off, I sent an e-mail to Starwood to complain, and was told they notified the hotel and someone from the hotel would be getting back to me. It's now been 2 weeks, and nothing. I have 3 trips to Dallas scheduled over the next 3 months, and have cancelled all of my reservations for this hotel. Take it from someone who travels a lot, and is a loyal Starwood member ... Look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Better Hotels in the Area”
Reviews.Author: SanAn2nioTX
Reviews.Content: Hotel reservation was booked through Hotwire. My husband and I were given a handicapped room. We requested another room as soon as we saw the room. Af first, we couldn't figure out why my dress was touching the floor in the closet. Then we saw the rest of the room...handicapped bath, doors, etc. Office staff was less than helpful..."sorry, we're fully booked." Yet, they did "try" to see if anything became available. No luck. The double bed was the worst night's sleep for two people. In the morning while checking out, the office staff said that the reservation from Hotwire indicated a handicapped room was requested. Contacted Hotwire and they in turn contacted the hotel. Hotwire did give us a $25 voucher for future bookings. The room had only one wash cloth, my husband had to bend down so he could dry his hair and see himself in the mirror. Definitely not worth regular price. Also, an $8 plus tax parking fee. We have stayed in the area before and have never been charged a parking fee (not valet either). Advice: always check the reservation prior to your arrival!

Reviews.Title: “Redicilous service,OMG I do travel 200 days per year and this was the worst experiance ever!”
Reviews.Author: Rob K
Reviews.Content: I had to beg every day for house keeping,I had to wait untill 2pm in messy room and with no clean towels. When I called for maid service Tamara from front desk said their housekeping working on "some" schedule...so If you have company/meeting in youjr room in afternoon you will have to skip houskeeping or your company/meeting. After two days of requesting earlier service they ingored calls from my room. The "cherry on cake" was when I went to front desk to ask for 30 min late checkout...and when Tamara realized it was my room # who beg her for housekeeping before noon every day,she said NO late checkout ..you have to be gone at noon. Redicilous experiance for me.Hotel Restaurant charged me for dinner when I didn't eat there. Now I have to dispute the charge. My room was very a nice and hotel is 10 min driving from Dallas downtown,but thats probably all what I can say was good.Before you will stay in this hotel try every other options in the area ..and there is a lot of hotels around!

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, not great. Would stay again if priced less than neighboring properties.”
Reviews.Author: DCDoctor
Reviews.Content: This was booked using Hotwire and the rate was very reasonable. I stayed for four nights, and the room was comfortable and spacious. Parking was $8. I stay in the area monthly and no other hotel charged me this. Front desk staff were less than friendly or helpful....unusual for Dallas, like another reviewer noted. Restaurant staff were similar. Room was clean. I appreciated the offer of credit at the hotel restaurant in exchange for bypassing daily maid service. This was a novel idea to me and is excellent for my circumstances as a solo business traveler. Highway noise entered the room at all hours and was distracting to me. It was louder than the norm. Charging for Internet service is outdated thinking.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cherrice
Reviews.Content: If you don't care about maid service, TV channels as advertised, the local shuttle service, finding anything to eat or drink during advertised hours of club lounge or helpful management and staff not to mention a restaurant we warned against eating in by other guest! Then go ahead and book your stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel, just understaffed”
Reviews.Author: ClermontRealtor
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was obviously stressed out...one agent had actually said at 11 that she was about to go home, but was still there at 3.... the bartender was doing her absolute best to help everyone but there is only so much one person can do. The room was AMAZING, clean, VERY comfortable bed, views, cooled, etc. NO complaints there. For it to be a convention type hotel, the restaurant was VERY lacking.... no lunch was available, dinner was very basic. Overall I would stay again if the rate was lower, no real amenities/restaurant, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Not what I thought a 4 star should be”
Reviews.Author: mmerc2004
Reviews.Content: We booked the Sheraton Suites for a little alone time. When Sheraton popped up on the "Negotiator" website after entering a 4 star place, I couldn't believe it put us on the boundary of the downtown area - away from any downtown/uptown attractions. Great if we were going to Medieval Times, but we were not. Not a problem, as long as the 4* rating was earned. We learned quickly that there was a problems the minute we stepped in the slightly musty lobby. Large drying fans were running and tiles from the ceiling were missing. I could barely hear the front desk guy while we were checking in, the fans were so loud. So far, not so good. Made our way up to the room. The lobby (outside of the wet-zone) was nice. You could tell that some remodel work had taken place. Didn't take in the restaurant, but neither was anyone else based on the empty tables. Didn't notice a bar, so no commentary there. When we got off the elevator, we were greeted by another drying fan on this floor, including the musty smell. Seems that this was more than a isolated problem. Inside the room, I have to admit, this was a 3.5* room with 4* space. Decent sheeting and amenities - 2 flat screens, sitting room, fridge, microwave. Except for the musty smell throughout, the room was perfectly acceptable for a Marriott/Hilton/Hyatt 3.5* property. Seems that Sheraton is trying to step up their game. If they fixed the leak, this would still be a 3-3.5* at best. Marking this a 4* does a disservice to a TRUE 4 star property right across the street. The Hilton Anatole is what defines a 4 star in that neighborhood. Not that you need to be big and brash, but don't try to call a converted Motel a 4 star. Pah-leeese!

Reviews.Title: “Overall good stay”
Reviews.Author: G_Conner
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel is very friendly and always stops to say hello. While the front desk staff is constantly busy, just acknowledge that fact and you will be waited on promptly. The first night I was there only one of the elevators was working and on the second and third days while the second one was now fixed it would not go to the 9th floor where my room was. The room was nice, it could use a little updating to bring it fully up to the times, but it was plenty nice. Perhaps on the next remodel the bedroom door could be changed to a pocket door as it made it a little awkward to get around the bed. Also, Internet is $9.95 per day, which is a little annoying (however I didn't have to pay since I have an AT&T wifi account) especially when a Holiday Inn Express offers it for free. Overall I would stay here again as it is a nice facility in a good location with a quick drive to get to the places I wanted to go.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: slattmando
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here 3 nights while we attended conference at a different hotel. The room was clean, spacious and beautiful! The staff was extremely helpful and professional. The experience was very much like staying at a boutique hotel. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Hotel To Get Away And Relax”
Reviews.Author: Texaspepper
Reviews.Content: A Great Hotel To Get Away And Relax. We booked it for our wedding anniversary get away from the house stay. Fort Worth/Dallas heat 100 and above that weekend and continues so the pool was our main attraction. Very relaxing. Staff at front desk very friendly and helpful. Our room was outstanding. A frig, Microwave and nice living room area, office desk and Internet (supplied as a wedding anniversary from front desk at check in). We loved it so much, I went out and shopped at Whole Foods and brought back Gumbo, shrimp cocktails, bread, cheese, breaded chicken breasts and such and we nuked it all and watched the July 4th Fireworks from our bedroom balcony. Don't miss staying here. Newly remodeled at a cost of $12 million.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, cheap breakfast, a bit difficult to reach w/o car”
Reviews.Author: GioVale20
Reviews.Content: We stayed for two nights to break our trip from Hawaii to Europe and got a great rate via Hotwire. The hotel is located just off I-35E opposite the Hitlon Anatole, less than 10 minutes by car from Downtown Dallas. The location is great if you have a car, but if you don't (as we didn't), there is nothing nearby except other hotels and Medieval Times. The DART Light Rail stop Market Center is about 15 minutes on foot in the heat and there is a bus stop closer to the hotel. We walked to the DART every morning and it was OK although the sidewalk stops for the last third of the walk. The hotel offers free shuttle within a radius of 3 miles to the hotel between 6am and 6pm (if I remember correctly). We used it twice and it worked perfectly. If you need the shuttle at given times, you can book it in advance. The room we received was on the fifth floor and was very nice. It was actually a two room suite with desk, sofa, TV in the first room and a huge king bed in the second with bathroom attached. The front desk staff was absolutely amazing throughout the stay. We arrived at 9 am and were given a room immediately even if check in time is 2 pm. Furthermore we found the breakfast buffet to be great value at 13.95$ + taxes and free internet is available at the PCs in the lobby. All in all we found the hotel perfect for our needs and would go back any time.

Reviews.Title: “Average hotel but good rates!”
Reviews.Author: jag_7896
Reviews.Content: This place was average all around. I will say that the front desk staff were very nice -- although not overly polished or professional. Our room was clean but a little shabby. The place is dated, and it shows a bit. Also a tad musty smelling at times. The suite layout was very nice and the room was spacious. The bed was very comfortable. Our rate was very low, so I do feel we got what we paid for. Overall, I can't really complain -- it was an average hotel at a very good rate.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed...”
Reviews.Author: Theres119
Reviews.Content: This looked like a nice hotel and a great location. We arrived straight from the airport at 3:15 and were told that no double rooms were available yet. We could wait in the lobby or come back later. The lobby seats were all full of people waiting for their own rooms to be ready. This was upsetting, I had prepaid for the specific type of room months before. I asked for local restaurants and told them we would be back. She gave me the phone number to check if our room was available before we returned. We got back after 5 and our room was ready. Maybe I am critical because I normally priceline my hotels and get a great deal, and this time I paid full price because I wanted to choose the location and make sure we had enough room to accommodate the whole family. The internet was not free and was $9.95 for 24 hours. Breakfast was also at a cost, we went out to Denny's instead of paying the inflated prices. Also the hot tub was not in operating condition the whole time we were there. The next day we went to the aquarium and saw great sites around Dallas. It was the hottest day of the year, about 104 degrees so a shower was due. When we returned at 5pm our room had still not been cleaned yet. We decided to go to dinner and then clean up after. Returning from dinner our room had been cleaned if you can call it that. The used soap was placed on a washcloth instead of being replaced. Only 2 clean towels were left in the room when I assure you at least 6 were taken out. No hand towels or washcloths were provided. I called to the desk and asked for towels and were told they would be right up. They never appeared. I complained again at check out but my service did not seem to be of their concern. A hotel of this caliber and price was very disappointing. You pay extra for everything and are still not taken care of.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient Dallas Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WKM1914
Reviews.Content: This Dallas area hotel provides a comfortable bed, a separate living room area and complimentary parking/breakfast for Starwoods Elite Members. The hotel had a great price and the location is not too inconvenient for an overnight stay in Dallas. The staff was friendly and helpful. Be careful where you park in the lot, however, my rental car was side-swiped overnight. Overall, a very good hotel in a decent location.

Reviews.Title: “Never again”
Reviews.Author: Ashlo
Reviews.Content: Found a hotel that I will truly never stay again. Went for Easter weekend and had a horrible time. Had to wait more than an hour after check in for room to be cleaned. The desk attendant never apologized just acted annoyed that we had showed up. As we quietly waited I noticed that most people checked right in without problem. I'm a usually patient person and very rarely complain however the way we were treated was down right rude. Finally we had to leave because we had tickets for Medieval times and couldn't wait any longer for our room. We had to repack the car. After our event we came back and were given a room that was still dirty. Really after four hours I would have thought we would get a clean room. The next day we ate at the breakfast buffet for $60 for four people we got instant eggs and bad bacon and cold biscuits. The whole experience left me feeling like we were ripped off and sad for a lost Easter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice”
Reviews.Author: CarolinaTraveler
Reviews.Content: Quick stay, less than 10 hours. Friendly front desk.Free parking, HUGE bottle of water, good room, great value.Rooms near interstate noisy

Reviews.Title: “Went for a shopping trip left with our car being robbed our last night”
Reviews.Author: nomegustawinter
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time shopping in Dallas. The location was great close the major highways and shopping locations. Staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were nice, but there was a tray of food left out in our hallway the whole time we were there, and it wasn't picked up. However our last night, our SUV was broken into (while parked under lights and in the front row of parking). They stole our backseat from our car and nothing else. Punched lock $200, missing back seat $3000. When we reported it the cop had mentioned how many times this had happened in just the past month in that parking lot. It's sad that it's become an issue and the hotel will not hire private security or put up security cameras. However we are lucky they did not break out our windshield..would have made for a terrible drive home.

Reviews.Title: “Great Home Away from Home”
Reviews.Author: 4458preston
Reviews.Content: We live in Dallas and had to move out of our house while part of the remodeling was going on. We stayed at the hotel for about ten days a year ago, and then returned recently for a short stay while the AC in our highrise was out. We looked at several suite hotel properties and chose this one as most upscale room for the price. While the bedroom is very tight on space, it works as the sleeping quarters with great bed and linens. There is a door from the bedroom to the bath and also a door from the living room to the bath which makes for a convenient flow for two people getting ready for work or business. While most of the furnishings are basic, they are well appointed and very functional. Our only wish was that the room had had a DVD player. We brought our own and it was easy to connect to the plasma TVs. Parking is easy. Location is great if you are doing business at Market and/or downtown. Front Desk staff is very friendly and helpful. They worked with us on rate since we were going to be there for awhile. We could have used this room for a month to homebase out of if we had needed to, even though it was not extremely large.

Reviews.Title: “Front Desk Staff Needs Help + Parking Ripoff”
Reviews.Author: biztrav101
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel a number of times. It's a reasonably nice hotel a few miles outside of Dallas but unfortunately in the middle of nowhere (essentially no restaurants around except a Denny's) and in a not-so-great neighborhood. Nevertheless, I've had reasonably good experiences here. I just tried to check in here shortly after 2 pm on a Sunday (moving from The Sheraton downtown to save some money). The parking lot is nearly empty which makes it highly unlikely that the hotel is sold-out tonight. So does the fact that rooms at this hotel have been available on Hotwire for days (I've stayed here enough times to be able to recognize this hotel on Hotwire). So does the fact that there is nearly no activity at all in the lobby. I understand that check-in time is 3 pm. But normally hotels will try to accommodate you if you arrive early and rooms are available. Particularly if it's already after 2 pm. Here, the female front desk clerk, whose name I'll be kind enough to omit, told me with a straight face that they had a full house last night (although probably not completely true since rooms were available on Hotwire, I'll assume that the hotel was nearly full and that her statement was mainly accurate) and that she wouldn't be able to give me a room until 3 pm because no rooms were ready yet. This is a complete insult to my intelligence. Obviously, they've been cleaning rooms as guests depart since early this morning. Obviously many guests have departed since the parking lot is nearly empty. Obviously, making the minimal amount of effort necessary to place a call to housekeeping to find an available room would allow me to check in. Instead, I was invited to spend money for an hour in their 11th floor lounge. Instead, I sat in the lobby working on my computer for a few minutes while the front desk clerks seemed to do nothing (other than turn away another guest until 3 pm). Then I realized how ridiculous the situation was and asked the same woman at the front desk to confirm for me that there were no clean rooms at 2:20 pm at what appears to be a now nearly empty hotel. She then proceeded to tell me that 172 parties had checked out last night. So I asked her if not one of those rooms was clean by this time. It was then that she - voila - made a call to housekeeping. And now, "miraculously", a room was available So she checked me in and can see that I am not handicapped yet places me in a room designed for the handicapped. I'm 6'2". The mirror in the handicapped room, among other things, is very low off the ground. I'm here for 3 nights. Common sense would dictate you wouldn't put a non-handicapped tall person in a room designed for the handicapped for 3 nights where i would have to, among other things, duck down to be able to look into the bathroom mirror. So I returned to the front desk. She blamed the 3rd party reservation system (Hotwire) and then, miraculously again, found another available regular room, despite the fact that it was only 2:30 pm.. A room that no doubt was available when I first asked to check in shortly after 2 pm. The room is fine - they are nice rooms which is the reason I've returned here a number of times, despite the less-than-ideal location. I also wanted to add that they've now instituted a $7.95 daily parking charge (new since the last time I was here). Sorry but this is a major rip-off It's one thing if the hotel was located downtown or where public transportation was available. But there's clearly no public transportation around here and essentially no way to get here or stay here without a car. So the reality is that the rooms cost $7.95 more than advertised. But rather than be intellectually honest about that and disclosing it (the website just says "self parking facilities", they instead just inform you of the parking charge when you arrive. Why not be honest and have free parking but charge $7.95 more for the rooms? Because being honest would be less profitable, i imagine. (If it's an issue keeping non-hotel guests from parking in the lot that could easily be solved by giving hotel guests a ticket to stick on the dashboard) Incidentally, this is the first time I've ever taken the time to write a review of a hotel. But I've pretty much been turned off to the Sheraton/Starwood brand on this trip and I'm a very frequent business traveler. There is a certain level of nickle-and-diming, I've unfortunately come to expect at "4 star" hotels. But between this and getting charged $5.01 for a 1 liter bottle of water at the gift shop at the Sheraton Dallas downtown , enough is enough. Particularly with the no-effort and lack of common sense service I just received at check-in. I thought others should be forewarned. P.S. Don't get me started on the internet charges, particularly the insane charges for the Sheraton Downtown which I haven't reviewed.

Reviews.Title: “Very Ugly Hotel. Not attractive at all......Internet pictures are very different. Disappointed!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sport69
Reviews.Content: The internet pictures were very disappointing. The hotel was very dirty!! The lobby was not bad. However, there were a lot of stains on the carpet all over the Hotel. The pool was not working (terrible for the kids). The knobs were off the windows in the elevator area. Then in our first room that we were given it had stains on back of the door and carpet. Then I asked for another room and it was a little better, only one stain. Will never stay at this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “really nice!”
Reviews.Author: laymanjamie20
Reviews.Content: room was attractive.very clean.has everything one would need.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms; lots of counter space; great clean beds”
Reviews.Author: kappatraveler
Reviews.Content: Rooms are spacious with a sitting room area and bedroom area with door in between. Mini bar area with lots of counterspace. Great desk for working and lots of power plugs. Shower is clean and water spray powerful. Beds are clean and sheets smell fresh. Drawback - 2 elevators and one was broken. BIG problem when you are attending a meeting and we all need to be in the lobby at a certain time. Wouldn't be that big a deal if the stairs were clearly marked. Staff were alright - I got the feeling they were doing the minimum amount of work rather then looking for ways to exceed expectations.

Reviews.Title: “Wasp problem”
Reviews.Author: bgregoryWichitaKs
Reviews.Content: Let me preface this by stating the staff was fantastic. A perfect 10 on them. The hotel has been remodeled, and is very nice! I had a room full of wasps that were nesting inside the slider door. I got stung during the night, finally discovered them under the curtains. Copious amounts of them. To the hotels credit they comped the stay. I would suggest that the maids do a little better job of surveying the room. If someone who was allergic stayed here and got stung it would be a litigators dream. All in all minus the wasps I would say this hotel is nice. During the remodel they did not abate the sound issues with heavy glass. The I 135 noise kept me up from about 0430 on. I did call for a fan but never received one.

Reviews.Title: “$12 Million Renovation for what?”
Reviews.Author: pbj2174
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel annually for the Texas vs. OU game. For the last several years both the condition of the property and the service have been getting increasingly worse. We were going to change hotels but the hotel boasted about the new ownership and all the money spent to renovate every single guest roome - i'm sorry the place again is worse - and the renovations clearly missed all of the 2nd floor. Carpets are filthy, sinks wont drain. The beds are really comfortable so that is a plus. The front desk staff is usually rude. As an example, i booked 3 rooms in my name for our group. Each person was with me at check in and wanted to transfer the rooms to their credit card. The front desk staff made this almost impossible. I finally had to threaten that i would deny the charges - then a manager appeared and they fixed it. The sign at the front says "new management that wants to ensure a 10 rated experience." I just haven't seen it. For next years game, we will look for somewhere else to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel kind of small”
Reviews.Author: dcfdue1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here the weekend of September 23rd-24th. The hotel was great and the rooms were nice but small. The beds were very comfortable and there were great amenities to this hote. I had the breakfast buffet Sunday morning and it was great! I would recommend this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Overall Good Value, Value Being the Key”
Reviews.Author: Doogt
Reviews.Content: Great price via expedia - $55 per night. This takes the edge of f of most of the negatives. BEWARE ... $8 per day to self park in a shared parking lot with other hotels. No Sheraton Club access on weekends or holidays. Room was a little cramped but adequate, especially at this rate. Promotional material talking up the renovation takes a bit of creative license but overall hotel is in good shape - strange bit of musty smell in the lobby. Rooms were fine. Pool is quite nice. You'll have to ignore the traffic noise from I-35. Well located for easy access to downtown and attractions along I-35 and I-75 corridors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Decor and Service”
Reviews.Author: _msmayor_nyc
Reviews.Content: Great hotel the price was good. The room had a great sitting area that may have been a sofa bed. The view was great. The bed was sooooo comfortable - my only tiny complaint would be the door from the bedroom to the sitting room had to remain closed when you use the closet - not really a complait but rather odd - sorry no free internet in the room only in the lobby - indoor and outdoor pools completed my stay!

Reviews.Title: “I would stay here again”
Reviews.Author: ArtistN
Reviews.Content: I attended a convention that was held at an adjacent hotel that was under construction. I had never been to this Sheraton before but my experience was very good. The suite was clean and had a great view of Downtown Dallas. They offer a free shuttle within 5 miles, which was great. The staff person took me to a nearby supermarket so I could do some grocery shopping - as the room had a fridge and microwave, which was a real cost saver! The air conditioning works so well that you should plan to bring a light jacket with you. I can't say enough about the friendly staff -- especially the folks at the front desk. Great job!

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms. Beds were amazing!”
Reviews.Author: jhouston
Reviews.Content: Great rooms. Beds were amazing!

Reviews.Title: “STAFF OF THIS HOTEL IS ATROCIOUS!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cjefferybowen
Reviews.Content: The staff is uneducated, poorly dressed and arrogant to the point of being so rude that weopted to leave in the middle of the night, which was also the middle of our stay. Do NOT ever stay here if you wish to be treated ike a human being.

Reviews.Title: “Be weary of their staff....ruined stay....”
Reviews.Author: andrewt333
Reviews.Content: Hotel itself was a very clean, modern and comfortable place to stay. The rooms were nicely furnished with excellent TV's and a wonderful bed to sleep in at night. The room had a small balcony which was nice while we watched the sunset. I would advise those staying here that a rental car is needed. It is not centrally located and there isn't much around the hotel. We did notice some taxi's but not frequently. Upon checkout, our whole stay was ruined and hence why I wouldn't recommend it to anyone. A day prior to checking out, my fiancee and I were hit by another car who blew a red light. I inquired about costs of using the phone to call home to New York. The staff member in the lobby quoted me a price. I was shocked at the low price and checked and double checked with her. At checkout, we were charged over $90 for phone usages (which added up to about 10 minutes of call time). I spoke to the manager who after some conversation wiped off the charges. Right before we were about to leave, the manager called us back to the counter. He had spoken to the staff member on duty. She had said I asked for charges for phone calls to the "Dallas area and were 1-800 numbers". A mistake is one thing but a lie is another. I'd be very weary because this could have turned out disastrous for someone else staying there. Not up to Sheraton standards.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4 star property in a good down-town fringe location”
Reviews.Author: LondonBusinessAgent
Reviews.Content: Stayed only one night at this Sheraton hotel whilst on an overnight connection at DFW from Mexico to London. Though it should be noted that this is in no way an airport property, we chose its down-town location specifically so we could go out on the 1 Saturday night we had in Dallas. Appox $45 in a cab from the airport, the hotel is clean, modern and after a week in Mexico, felt like heaven. Pretty much what one would expect from Sheraton, the rooms (all suites) are modern, clean and functional. The pool area was nice - though was full of kids on our stay (during summer holidays). The hotel is located across the road from the Dallas World Trade Centre, so would be perfect for stays involving this. As for our purpose of going out down-town, the location was ok... Still needed to get a cab most places - though I have since been told that this is the norm in Dallas regardless of what hotel you stay in. Check-in staff were friendly, helpful and more than happy to give directions / advice etc. I do wish I had got the name of the check in guys - potentially Lebanese of origin â€“ as he provided some of the friendliest, professional and upbeat service I have received in any hotel in the world this past year - and I clock well over 180 hotel nights a year. I would have liked to let the management know of their excellent staff â€“ hopefully they read Trip Advisor and can place him. Overall, this hotel represents great value for money. The filling continental breakfast for only $9 in the morning was great. Would I stay here again if in Dallas? If the price was reasonable (below 150) then yes, without question!

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: tommygunshreveport
Reviews.Content: well let me start out by saying it was clean,but we could not get the room cool and the door going into the bathroom was like opening a vault.then we was woken up by a car alarm and later found out that that it must have been my car because on the way home i noticed the power mirror switch was broken.when i called to complain they said there was security cameras and would review them,just to find out there was no cameras in that section,right!!! when i left a message with the manager,he never called me back twice.!! so find another place that is safer to stay and more professional!!! oh and now i have to get my car fixed. oh and the parking cost 8 dollars!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place to stay for Dallas”
Reviews.Author: jakestone
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of days, and liked it. Smaller suites, but very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Refined Modernness and Charm within Big City Limits”
Reviews.Author: Vemnox
Reviews.Content: The Sheraton Market Center was the result of a Hotwire random bid fare and I was able to grab a room at a ridiculous price for what we got. Nestled extremely close to downtown Dallas without actually being IN Downtown Dallas, the hotel's close proximity to the interstate makes it ideal for either business or leisure travelers. In simple words, here are my pro's/con's: PRO's: location, very modern with TWO flat panel TV's, extraordinarily clean, all the extras in your room such as a hair dryer, microwave, fridge, and coffee maker - all included, great king size bed, nice view of the city skyline CON's: location adjacent to the highway means noise (not tons, but still noticable), king size bed takes up literally ALL of the bedroom with VERY little room to walk, parking costs $8 a night, staff gave me the wrong room first then gave me a non-working key ... took way longer to finally get in my correct room than it should have, no free internet, hotel essentially didn't care that I was stranded in the middle of Downtown Dallas (and so were a half dozen other people) after a concert; consistently received conflicting information about where/when the shuttle goes and operates; should pick up anywhere within a certain radius; ended up paying $20 just to get a cab to take me 1.2 miles from Downtown to the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: doodoo999
Reviews.Content: Great hotel for a business even - very comfortable and the food, though pricey was delicious and plentiful. Recommend it we were quite happy there for 3 nights!

Reviews.Title: “Not good...not bad...just ok”
Reviews.Author: Andangi
Reviews.Content: I always enjoy staying in suites, but this is my first experience where I felt cramped in a suite. The bathrooms were modern but narrow. The sliding door connecting the bathroom to the bedroom was difficult to manuever. Probably could have used more WD40 or something to help it slide easier. We had a king size bed and the bed practically took up the entire bedroom. If the door connecting the bedroom to the living room was open, there was absolutely no walking space in the bedroom. The living area was decent. The room only looks bigger because the furniture is so compact. I'm a petite person and the only place where I could really find space to relax in was the king bed. The service was the worst. Housekeeping eventually told me that not only were they overbooked, but they were also understaffed that weekend. Parking is not free. I was surprised because I've never been to a hotel where they charge for parking when there is a huge lot surrounding the hotel. My friend ended up parking right outside the bordering ropes so he did not have to pay the fee. With all that said, I did enjoy the location of the hotel. Our main need was to be close to downtown. We were located not directly in downtown, but just mere minutes away from it. A short ride on the freeway and we were there pretty fast.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyed stay, great value”
Reviews.Author: herendeyr
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4 night stay at Sheraton Suites Market Center in Dallas as sort of a conference mistake that listed the Market Center address when it was intended for the downtown Dallas Sheraton address where the conference actually took place. That mistake was actually well worth it since the pricing was much much better (we pre-paid our room for an another discount), and although downtown was only 2 miles away, the Market Center Sheraton provided a courtesy shuttle service (based on availability). The hotel facilitated this service for us to get to and from downtown which is about a 10 minute ride. The room was very nice, looked brand new and it had a separate living room from bedroom each containing a panel TV, and kitchenette had a microwave, fridge and coffeemaker. Usually room coffee is just ordinary to me, but here they had tasty Starbucks I really enjoyed. We were on the 10th floor and for some reason needed to use our key card in the elevator to get to that floor level. This was my first time in a Sheraton but last time I had to use my key to access the floor of my room was at a Ritz Carlton where the floor had certain niceties that were available only to the guests of that floor. I didn't see anything special on our floor at the Sheraton. We enjoyed the pool and hot tub. Really liked how the pool is partially indoors and outdoors. During our visit the weather was too cold to use the outdoor part, but indoors it was nice and heated. The gym faces the pool and looked all new but we didn't use it although it was tempting to use what looked like all new equipment, or at least sit there and watch the panel TV in the center of the room. Another enjoyable amenity is the Sheraton Link which is their comfortable lounge setup by the lobby where guests have free internet access, and if you didn't bring your laptop you can use on of theirs along with a printer that's situated there. Although the hotel has a nice looking restaurant, the only time we ate there was for room service on the first night. Our last meal was at a Denny's just a short walk around the corner. There was also the option to go around the other corner but that would end up at the Medieval Times. Those 2 places are the only ones within a short walk from the hotel which is why I believe their courtesy shuttle service is really a valuable amenity. I believe the service goes as far as a 3 or 5 mile radius from the hotel. The best way to work this is to mention to the front desk in advance (like the night before, or early morning) that you'd need a ride for a certain time that way they can arrange to accommodate. There were a couple of occasions where I didn't pre-arrange and the shuttle was completely booked, and the other was when the next shuttle was leaving at the time I needed to already be in downtown at 4pm (it was already 3:30pm). For those 2 occasions we took a taxi. Keep the front desk number handy in case you'll need to call to make sure shuttle is on its way to pick you up. Due to our schedule, our only sightseeing in Dallas was in the Historic West End District. I thought the Dallas Aquarium would just be a fishbowl, but I was impressed with how much was put in one place that there was actually a good number and a variety of exhibits that it's really much more than an aquarium. It's was more like a zoo and an aquarium in an indoor ecological setting. My favorite exhibit was the jaguar since most zoos keep them at a distance, but here it was right next to us only separated by a thick glass wall. After the aquarium we only had enough time for one more place so we ended up at the 6th floor museum since that is unique to only Dallas, afterwards going outside to the 'grassy knoll' and the 'X' in the middle of the Elm street. So in summary about our visit to Dallas, our stay at the Sheraton Suites MC very enjoyable and was well worth the savings that even though wasn't conveniently located as the downtown location, their shuttle service more than made up for it. The service staff from the front desk, room service and shuttle drivers were all friendly and hospitable to us. I would recommend this hotel to people planning a trip to Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Some staff very helpful, maids may take a break in your room!”
Reviews.Author: legonzal
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the Beta Convention. We came with 70 students and adults. We had reserved 23 rooms well in advance. Every time we called we were told something different in regards to our reservation. One time we were told we had double the amount of rooms we needed and one time we had 7 too few. We were told we could not be sent an invoice out so we decided to pay at the hotel and be reimbursed. BIG MISTAKE!! We spent 3 1/2 hours at the front desk trying to check out. The women who was "helping" us clearly did not know what she was doing and was not very understanding to our frustration. She made it seem as if we were a bother to her. On the other hand Luke (also at the front desk) was extremely helpful and made our lengthly check in process very smooth. After receiving our keys we went and checked all the rooms, one of them had not been cleaned (at 5PM) and we had one parent tell us they walked into their room and found the maid in their room laying on the bed watching TV. We choose this hotel because the convention is held here, while the rooms were nice they were definitely not worth the hassle. We are looking into other nearby hotels for next year.

Reviews.Title: “Find a better deal elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: jayhawkfanOK
Reviews.Content: I will never again stay at a Sheraton anywhere. We were in town for the National Cheer Association Cheer competition. The hotel was completely booked so it was not surprising that there were a few issues. Upon arrival at 5pm there were several in our group who were told their rooms were not ready and some had to wait a good hour and a half before getting into their rooms. When people in our group had booked their hotel rooms some had been told breakfast was included and others were told it was not included. This confusion continued at check in. As it turned out another cheer group was supposed to have breakfast included. Because so many had been told breakfast was included the RIGHT thing for management to do would have been to give out the breakfast coupons. Young kids don't eat much, and I hardly think it would have caused them to lose money. By far the biggest concern was that one of the elevators broke down on Saturday afternoon. Now, I did not mind having to climb the stairs to the 7th floor. There were several in our group though who came down the stairs to find the ground floor stairwell door LOCKED. What if there had been a fire in a completely booked hotel with one elevator and one service elevator? We had two in our group who were in wheelchairs. I know it was overwhelming for the staff, but it was quite obvious that only a few were well trained. I did find the room to be small but clean. I did not notice glasses just being wiped clean. MY only complaint in regard to cleanliness would be that the blanket for the pull out sofa was definitely not clean and there was only one sheet. Fortunately when I asked for another sheet I ended up with a much nicer blanket (but no extra sheet). One more thing, I think it's important for guests to be informed of the parking fee when they check in. I found the parking fee to be reasonable for a downtown hotel, but for people who have not traveled much those small fees can add up.

Reviews.Title: “Great deal for my family”
Reviews.Author: FamilyDad22
Reviews.Content: We only stayed one night on a weekend excursion. The hotel looks great. The room was terrific. AThe bed was super, lots of comfy sheets and blankets. I loved the balconey too. I smoke, so I just went out there and was fine. by the way, alll of our glasses were clean. So was everything else, super clean in fact. I was kind of put off on the extra $8 to park my car. They claimed it was for security, but we went back and forth to the car several times and never saw anyone "looking-out" for anything. But whatever, it doesn't sway me, I liked the place. Having the bedroom and living room separated with a door is GREAT for Mom and Dad. (*wink). We folded out the couch and the kids where good. I did hear a dog bark way down the hall on the way out once. I had no idea dogs were allowed. My son yelled to be quite and the dog went off barking. I kicked the rooms door super hard and it shut up the rest of the trip. ha We did not eat at the bar or drink there. And my phone has internet, so I didn't really care how much they charged for that. It does have free access in the lobby and several computers. My son enjoyed those for a little bit. Basiclly if you are looking for a nice place to sleep, with comfortable rooms and beds and looks fantastic, this is the place. If you want your home with a maid, a chef, and a bartender for free, you need to belly up a few extra bucks. At only $80/ night we were thrilled and pleased.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location to downtown and mall area, serivces needs a little help”
Reviews.Author: travelcord
Reviews.Content: I found a great deal on the hotelâ€™s website and decided to spend 2 nights there. I made a last minute reservation for a club king. I also had called the hotel prior to my arrival with some questions about parking, I was told it was $8.61, ok not a problem. When I arrived at the hotel that evening I was checking in and the young lady stated she was going to put me on the 6th floor. I asked I thought I booked a club floor room and then she checked my reservation again and said that the 10th floor was the highest she could put me. I was fine with that and I am not very picky on room location unless I book a specific room for example club or executive. Also I asked if I was going to be charged for parking and she said they are not going to charge another big plus plus. Iâ€™m not upset with that at all. I was also informed that the club lounge was closed a big disappointment for me because I booked it because the lounge serves breakfast and afternoon snacks. I was given a complementary breakfast buffet voucher for every day of my stay. I arrived to my room on the key access floor; the room was very spacious and nice. The room also had a cordless phone and in addition to the bathroom door there was a pocket door that went into the bedroom. I will agree with the other reviews about the bedroom being small but there is still ample space to move about especially if going out on the balcony. The other review that I will agree with is the service. Another large concern is that the hotelâ€™s wares from the glasses in the room, ice bueckts, and dinnerware did not look like they were properly washed and sterilized. The drinking glasses in the room had spots on them and on some one could tell they were just wiped on the inside. How are they being cleaned and if they are then what is being used. This reminded me of the incident a few years ago where a hotel maid was using dirty linens to clean the glasses in the room. The hotel needs some help in this area and staff communication is poor when it comes to sitting down for breakfast and if maintenance on the room is needed. I called the 1st night with a maintenance issue; the desk stated that they would send someone right away. One hour passed with no knock on the door. I called again and another desk agent answered and I had to fill him in on the issue and within less than 10 minutes a maintenance representative came to the room to address the issue with the room.( pocket door on the bathroom was broken). Also there was an extra charge on my bill from the 1st night that was not mine. I called the desk and inquired about the charge. They agent said he would get back with me when he had looked into my bill. Turns out that someoneâ€™s bar tab was posted on my bill without verifying the room number. I had explained to the agent that I am not a drinker and I ended up going down to the desk when there was not need, but I will give him credit for working on that for me. He was very nice and helpful to resolve that issue. At breakfast my last day there I felt ignored by the wait staff, I was greeted when I came into the restaurant but no one check on how I was doing when I sat down at the table, when I was finished with my meal someone finally can to check on me and I was ready to leave so I handed the person my voucher and left. The staff is very friendly and nice but lack organization, there was too going on for a small crowd, I would have expected this only if the restaurant was super full and busy. My overall experience is that this is a nice hotel, but the staff communication needs much improvement. I will return to this hotel the next time I am in the area. Please note: I recommend if you are a new guest to a hotel to print a copy of your reservation just to make sure you get what was reserved and if there is real drinking glasses in the room to use plastic cups unless one can tell that the glasses are replaced daily with clean ones.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice and Close to the City”
Reviews.Author: stevemustangred
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night for the Dallas White Rock Marathon. Staff is very friendly and accommodating. I think the hotel has recently been renovated. One of the nicest hotels we have stayed at this year. Having the Suite was nice, but the bedroom was really tiny. There wasn't much room for more than the bed. There was absolutely no hallway noise in the bedroom since we could close the bedroom door. The hotel is right next to the expressway and has sliding balcony doors so there will be some traffic noise, but we get the convenience of being able to hop on the freeway easily. The bed and pillows were comfortable. The room was very clean and everything worked.

Reviews.Title: “Dallas sports weekend”
Reviews.Author: tabnrich
Reviews.Content: We went to a Dallas Cowboys game and then a Dallas Mavericks game all within a day of each other stayed at this hotel and had a wonderful experience. There was everything we needed and then some 2 tvs a seperate room to entertain, the bed was heavenly soft and large. The balcony was great even on the 4th floor. The clerks at the front desk were nice and courteous. The bathroom was clean and 2 ways to enter a plus, The microwave and refrigerator was well welcomed and I guess most of all it was quiet and did not look like a hotel room more like your house in a smaller version. We plan to visit everytime we are in Dallas, great great experience.

Reviews.Title: “More pros than cons”
Reviews.Author: Dianna/Texas
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for just one night recently. Had made my reservation a few weeks in advance, and requested a room on a high floor with a skyline view. When we checked in we were given a room on the second floor in the back of the hotel. Requested to change and were given a room on the 8th floor with a downtown Dallas view. Not sure why we weren't given this room in the first place. Front desk staff weren't rude, but a little aloof. The hotel is way more attractive on the inside than the outside, so don't judge this hotel by it's "cover". The lounge/restaurant area was updated and attractive. Free internet lounge a bonus, complete with flat screen TV to catch up on a game or news. Overall a good value. The room was pretty nice. Yes, the bedroom is small, but still accommodates a King size bed. Beware of the sliding pocket door that seperates the bedroom and bathroom. Ours was very tight, and I ended up smashing my index finger trying to shut it (fingernail purple and all that). Bed comfortable and pillows good. Traffic noise not an issue. Good shower pressure and plenty hot water. Towels good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here if you want to make your own bed & listen to freeway noise!”
Reviews.Author: Jazzyredflower
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for three nights recently and I WILL NEVER BOOK HERE AGAIN or with another Sheraton for that matter. I initially selected this hotel based off reading past reviews and the $99/night rate. I thought I scored gold when the rate went down to $74/night after I booked at the higher rate & the hotel adjusted it. When we checked in, we were impressed at how nice the hotel looked. We got to the room and thought it was a little small. The king sized bed left very little clearance for walking around. If we weren't careful, we would bang our sides & arms on the closet handles and dresser. My boyfriend is a pretty big guy & the tight fit was very frustrating. We stayed in room 811 which faced out on Stemmons Freeway. The constant noise from traffic was unbelievable. If you are a light sleeper, you will be very unhappy here. We heard sirens from every emergency response vehicle that went by, the noise from motorcycles and the engine noise from all other vehicles. We came back to our room very late the first evening after having fun in the city. We got a disgusting surprise when we discovered that our shower did not drain properly. I took my shower first and after being in it for a few minutes, the water was up to my ankles. By this time it was 2 o'clock in the morning & we decided to complain the next day. I made a call to the front desk & was told someone would come take a look at it. NO ONE EVER CAME. We came back late the next evening to discover the same scenario & also realized that OUR SHEETS HAD NOT BEEN CHANGED. I know this because earlier that morning before we left, I dropped my lipstick on the bed & it smeared on the top & bottom sheet. Low & behold, the same sheets were still on, but the bed had been made to cover it up. Housekeeping came the next morning while we were still getting dressed. I cracked the door & told her we needed just a few more minutes. We left for the day & came back to a dirty room & unmade bed (this was around 5pm). I called guest services & they assured me that someone from housekeeping was on the way. We even left so we would not be in the way. We came back two hours later and THE ROOM WAS STILL NOT CLEAN. I went down to the front desk to complain & the person on duty told me that someone would be up right away. HOUSEKEEPING KNOCKED & HANDED ME A STACK OF TOWELS & SHEETS AND WALKED AWAY. I HAD TO MAKE UP MY OWN BED!!!!!! I was thoroughly disgusted by this! I went down to the front desk & the manager seemed very surprised by this, but didn't do anything. She offered to remove my parking charges, but other that that it didn't seem like a big deal. My recommendation is to find another place that will care about your experience and appreciate your business. STAY SOMEWHERE ELSE!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Stay”
Reviews.Author: brown36
Reviews.Content: Really enjoyed my stay at the Sheraton. The room was so nice and the bed was to die for it was so comfortable. Plan on staying there again everytime I am in Dallas.

Reviews.Title: “Unbeatable value”
Reviews.Author: Nittany13
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several times and really you cannot beat it. The rooms are new and awesome with two flat panel TVs, all new furniture, etc. The hotel is in the market center area, not directly downtown but just a five minute cab ride away.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, Clean, Nice choice for Business/ Few Surprises”
Reviews.Author: sharem57
Reviews.Content: Good solid choice. Good value. Great Plasam TV's. Comfortable and easy to use thermostats. Room service was efficient and the delivered food was tastey. Bed, king sized and very comfortable. Every time I needed one a Taxi was sitting out front even though this hotel is not in the downtown section of BIG D. I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “A real gem, large beautiful rooms with 2 plasma tv's, nice staff, great pool and great reasonably priced restaurant”
Reviews.Author: LisainAZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel three nights in July during a business trip and was pleasantly surprised at the accomodating staff and beautiful spacious suite style rooms. Each room has a living room with a pull out sofa and a plasma and mini fridge with one of the most comfortable beds and bedding I have ever slept in. A good nights sleep in their luxuriously plush duvet covers and huge overstuffed fluffy pillows had me waking up with a huge smile on my face and each room has a balcony with a beautiful view of the dallas skyline. The hotel is located in a nice convenient area close to Dallas Lovefield airport and all Dallas attractions and restaurants. The indoor/outdoor pool and spa was very nice and the gym had brand new equipment...I was impressed. My overall stay was very pleasant and the food in the restaurant was very good and very reasonably priced. I would highly recommend and will definitely be returning here next month.
